results.title: Max and Noel Oliver's story
results.brief_description:
Alzheimer’s sufferer Max together with his wife Noel have told a story for their granddaughters that celebrates their life together as well as capturing Max’s memories of his son, the children’s father, who died when they were very young. Created as part of the ‘Memory’s Voice: Capturing Stories of Courage’ workshop, an ACMI Digital Storytelling Project in association with Alzheimer’s Australia Vic and in partnership with VicHealth.
You can create your own Digital Story. Ask at the Information Desk or visit www.acmi.net.au/digitalstorytelling

group.title: Memory's voice: capturing stories of courage

results.title: The Girl I love: music video for the band Positronic
results.creator_credit: Advanced Diploma of Multimedia (ADoM), Swinburne University of Technology (formerly Electronic Design and Interactive Media (EDIM) and Stephen Clarke
results.brief_description: This animated music video was created in 3D studio Max for student’s band - Positronic. Although it was the first time that he had used this software, he makes the most of simple scenes, metaphorical imagery and 3D ariel effects to effectively communicate the song’s message - A small town girl leaves her home to find fame and fortune in the big city, leaving beind her boyfriend who must come to terms with her departure.
results.title_for_label: The Girl I love: music video for the band Positronic

results.title: The Other side
results.creator_credit: Advanced Diploma of Multimedia (ADoM), Swinburne University of Technology (formerly Electronic Design and Interactive Media (EDIM) and Zaljko Radic
results.brief_description: A 3D animation without dialogue. Kids will love this simple story with a Jules Verne influence. A moustached man in a brightly coloured flying machine travels through a surreal futuristic landscape searching for a lost city…Created using Lightwave, After FX and Premiere

results.title: Laser treatment
results.brief_description: This secondary school student work displays a mature understanding of the documentary form. Taking a look at Rave culture, ‘Laser Treatment’ combines live footage of a rave with DJs and Raver interviews, achieving a good balance of information and entertainment.
results.description: This secondary school student work displays a mature understanding of the documentary form. Taking a look at Rave culture, ‘Laser Treatment’ combines live footage of a rave with DJs and Raver interviews, achieving a good balance of information and entertainment.

results.title: For my girls
results.brief_description: Gabby uses her Digital Story to tell her daughters about the inspiring life of their father, who died of a heart attack at the age of 31. Created as part of ‘The Heart of the Story’ an ACMI Digital Storytelling Project in association with the National Heart Foundation of Australia (Victorian Division) and in partnership with VicHealth.

results.title: What's for dinner?
results.brief_description: This 3D animation tells the story of Angus and his overbearing mother Beryl. Eventually Angus must decide whether he wants to rid himself of Beryl forever…to be continued, Completed as part of a visual arts degree in graphic design

results.title: Prism of purpose
results.brief_description: Gabo Island - Artist Alexandra Lyall’s paintings of the Gabo Island lighthouse provide haunting visuals to her moving account of the role the lighthouse played in a tragic family history.This work uses digital technology cleverly to allow you to experience Alexandra’s paintings in a new way.

results.title: Drive
results.brief_description: ‘Drive’ takes the watcher on a drive through the bright lights and dark corners of a big city. The animation uses a combination of 3D animation and line drawing to surreal effect giving the work a dreamlike quality - not unlike the experience of driving through the city at night.

results.title: Sailor's dream
results.brief_description: A sailor’s body is marked by experience. As he lies sleeping a sailor remembers incidents from his life – as illustrated by his many tattoos
